title: Self-Efficacy: Toward a Unifying Theory of Behavioral Change
summary: Self-efficacy is the belief in one's ability to succeed. It is built primarily through 'mastery experiences' (small wins). High self-efficacy leads to greater persistence and resilience.

effectiveness_metrics.description: People with high self-efficacy try harder and longer in the face of obstacles.

mechanisms.name: Mastery Experiences
mechanisms.description: Success breeds success. Small wins build the confidence needed for larger tasks.

mechanisms.name: Vicarious Experience
mechanisms.description: Seeing others succeed (or a digital avatar) can boost belief.

mechanisms.name: Verbal Persuasion
mechanisms.description: Encouragement from a credible source (the app).

actionable_strategies.name: Small Wins Ladder
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: If a user fails a 20-min block, suggest a 5-min block next. Completing it restores self-efficacy through a 'mastery experience'.

actionable_strategies.name: Credible Encouragement
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Instead of generic 'Good job', say 'You focused for 15 minutes straight, which is 5 minutes longer than yesterday.'
